subject: RE: [junit] Websphere Studio Application Developer
msgSnippet: Did all of that...and I m not using Eclipse, but I am using Websphere Developer which is based on Eclipse. I extracted the org.eclipse.BLAH folders to the
messageBody:
Did all of that...and I'm not using Eclipse, but I am
using Websphere Developer which is based on Eclipse.
I extracted the org.eclipse.BLAH folders to the plugin
directory and restarted. I don't see any addition
options under the Run dropdown, just the standard:

- Server Launcher
- Run-time Workbench
- Run-time Workbench with Tracing
- Java Application

I'm now search through the directories (Program
Files/IBM/Application Developer) to see if there's
another XML file or something I need to add some info
to.

(shrug)

Thanks,

-Eric

--- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> Assuming that you've done this:
> 1. download the plugin org.junit - JUnit 3.7
> packaged as
> an Eclipse plugin.
> Notice: Since build 20011218 org.junit is part
> of the
> SDK build and doesn't need to be downloaded.
>
> 2. download the plugin org.eclipse.jdt.junit - the
> JUnit
> Eclipse plugin.
>
> 3. extract the plugins into the plugins directory
> of your Eclipse install.
>
> To run a unit test single click on it and then go to
> the run menu dropdown
> and select run - run Junit tests".
>
